content.description: This is a fun, unusual face with smooth, patinated rock and some pockets.  It's in a sunny location.
content.location: Near the left end of the south face and up high.

content.description: Begin on the gouged out north face of a boulder below Iron Maiden and climb in a left diagonal direction to a bolt. Traverse left (powerful moves) to the east face past two more bolts. Very technical and balancy moves lead up and right past one more bolt to a hand crack which goes to the top of the boulder.
content.protection: Quickdraws and a medium cam for a hand crack. Medium cams are needed for an anchor.

content.description: Begin near the right end of a large south-facing boulder adjacent to the south face of the Snickers formation. A reachy move on a slightly overhanging face gains the first of six bolts. Continue more or less straight up on positive hand holds to the fifth bolt. Move left (crux) on slopers and up past one more bolt to the top. Fun and well-protected climbing on grainy but solid rock.
content.protection: Quickdraws for six bolts. A bolted anchor with runners is on the flattened top of the boulder.

climbs.name: Rock Shark
climbs.fa: Alan Nelson, Alfred Randell, Shartel McVoy, 12/1987.

content.description: Thin steep vertical crack with helpful dents and face edges.  Walk off to climber's right.
content.protection: Thin to small, with BD 0.75, #2, or #3's for gear anchor, or sling rope around a giant boulder.
content.location: Located to the right of the twin cracks of Funny Money and to the left of Henny Penny.

content.description:
A long reach out from under the bulge will get your fingers into the lip like crack.  Hand traverse and rand hook your way across to the vertical crack then up.  When the crack goes vertical you may need to scoop some dirt or sand out of crack.  I believe a loose block that lived in there is now gone.  Gets 3 stars for the coolness of the lip crack and location.

This route was named after the song in West Side Story.  Mr. Cilley always loved them showtunes!
content.protection: In an ad for Aliens, Hidetaka Suzuki is leading this route on what I would guess are Aliens.  If you were going to lead it, stuff in the 1/2" to 3/4" range should go in the traversing section.  I can't really remember what would go in the vertical section, but a guess would be cams around 1" to 1.5"
content.location: This is the obvious slash going from low left to up and right across the bulging lip on the South Face of Snickers.  A nice warm spot in the winter.  Descend to climbers left.

content.description: Climb a prominent dike on the wall also contains the routes The Art of Deception, and Swimming in a Sea of Deception to the left (though blocked by a boulder). .
content.protection: Basically a solo or top rope
content.location: The dike faces the east face of Little Rock Candy Mountain which is 500 yards to the west

content.description:
This route is located in the back of a narrow canyon on the overhanging southeast face of the Snickers formation.

The first pitch (11+) begins on a block at the top of a short chimney. Clip a bolt and climb into a dihedral. Technical stemming and gastons lead past three more bolts to a short discontinuous crack. Clip one more bolt and move right using a diagonal hand rail to a small platform. Moves on loose rock above the platform lead to a belay ledge.

The sustained and short second pitch (11+) continues past four bolts adjacent to a shallow, flared crack on grainy but solid rock.

This climb would be a classic if the rock was consistently solid.
content.protection: Quickdraws for five bolts and small TCU's (#1 - #3) on the first pitch. Quickdraws for four bolts on the second pitch. Bolted anchors are at the top of each pitch. Two rappels to the bottom with one rope.

climbs.name: Henny Penny
climbs.fa: Kevin Powell, Darrel Hensel, Alan Roberts, 1985.

content.description: Thin vertical crack up through two bushes.  Dirty.  Walk off to climber's right.
content.location: Located to the right of Rock Shark and left of When You're A Jet.

content.description: This is a loose, ant-infested hand crack - not a recommended climb.
content.protection: hand-size cams and a long-sleeve shirt
content.location: It's about 50 yards right and on a wall above When You're A Jet.

content.description: Start up right-slanting crack to gain a big ledge (more fun and more in-line than up the chimney at end of corridor as book says), then up a single crack that becomes twin cracks for the upper half.  Steep for the rating.
content.protection: Standard rack, gear anchor.  Walk off to climber's right, with a quick shimmy down an easy short offwidth.
content.location: Located on the sunny south side of Snickers.  Closest parking is actually the first or second pullout along the road from Echo Tee to Barker Dam, a shorter walk than from Echo Tee big lot.
